title: (x) Grafik Magazine geometric sans - ITC Avant Garde Gothic {Jamesy Love}
content:
Can anyone tell me what font this is?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031101347im_/http:/typophile.com/files/grafik150_01_3478.jpg)
author: deviant_artiste

comments.content: Its ITC Avant Garde supplied by yellowblack.com
can we just start saying, "it's avant garde. AGAIN." because, i mean, god.

Try to read the magazine -- I dare you. _All text_ in Grafik is set in ITC Avant Garde Gothic. I wanted to read my own article ("Anatomy of a typeface: Odile" of almost a year ago) and couldn't. I tried, I swear, but honest to God, it's unbearable.
… but I do like the URL: yellowblack.com. It's so … ahm … redirecting in a refreshing style. ;^D
Thanks Rez Oo - I guess some of us are more helpful than others, after all this is a Type ID forum!

\> _I guess some of us are more helpful than others, after all this is a Type ID forum!_

Do I discern a tinge of rebuke in that observation? Please elaborate. (You can tell I've been watching a lot of [Deadwood](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031101347/http:/www.hbo.com/deadwood/) lately ;^) :^P
some of us are perfectly helpful; we're just tired of avant garde and the kneejerk irony applied to it these days.

I agree it's not easy to read, but it doesn't help the letter-spacing and leading are unnecessarily tight.

Just thought I would also mention it's different from the Adobe Std, the captial R changes between book and bold, not so in the Adobe Std release.
